page.title: 05PARK LODGE G.L.C. FARM
page.content: The Greater London Council operates a scheme which allows children from the inner city areas of the capital to experience the benefits of a holiday in the country whilst at the same time learning something about the difficulties of living together as a group - 24 hours a day. The scheme is based at Park Lodge Farm, a working farm to the south of the village. The children are housed in the old farmhouse in dormitary accomodation and are expected to take part in a series of activities designed to both stimulate and educate. In the current unstable political and economic climate, it is possible that the G.L.C. may not continue in its present form and that this unique facility may have to be abandoned.
